snippet: Taliban insurgents claimed on Thursday to have executed 15 paramilitary troops who were kidnapped from northwestern Pakistan last month.
abstract: Taliban insurgents execute 15 Pakistani security soldiers who had been kidnapped in a tribal region near the border of Afghanistan and dump their bodies on a hilltop, in retaliation for the killing of a high-ranking Taliban commander by government forces.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and ISMAIL KHAN
byline.contributor: Salman Masood reported from Islamabad, and Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Taliban insurgents claimed on Thursday to have executed 15 paramilitary troops who were kidnapped from northwestern Pakistan last month.

headline.main: 15 Kidnapped Pakistani Soldiers Executed by the Taliban in a Retaliatory Gesture
headline.print_headline: 15 Kidnapped Pakistani Soldiers Executed by the Taliban in a Retaliatory Gesture
